intro: Descurainia kochii, commonly known as Koch's tansy, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate, pinnately divided leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
